metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6306 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The certificate parser in OpenSSL before 1.0.1u and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2imight allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-boundsread) via crafted certificate operations, related to s3_clnt.c ands3_srvr.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6306` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu9
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu9').
